_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The unskillful actions born of greed, ha: Choosing to act by way of body, speech, or mind
Causing another to suffer under a false pretext by execution, imprisonment, confiscation, condemnation, or banishment
The bad, unskillful things produced in t: Ill-timed, false, meaningless, not in line with the teaching and training speech
The skillful actions born of contentment: Choosing to act by way of body, speech, or mind
Not causing another to suffer under a false pretext by execution, imprisonment, confiscation, condemnation, or banishment
The skillful things produced in them, bo: Well-timed, true, meaningful, in line with the teaching and training speech
The result of cutting off bad, unskillfu: Bad unskillful qualities are cut off at the root
They are made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future
In the present life, the person is happy, free of anguish, distress, and fever
Bad unskillful qualities are extinguished in the present life
